intro: Pedicularis acmodonta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Pedicularis acmodonta is typically found in open, rocky habitats and is known for its delicate, ephemeral blooms.
